docs.lead_paragraph: The following is a transcript of the Democratic Presidential debate in Philadelphia, as provided by Federal News Service.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president lashed out again today at Congress, criticizing it for “a constant string of investigations.”

headline.main: Bush Says Congress Is Wasting Time
headline.print_headline: Bush Says Congress Is Wasting Time

docs.snippet: The president lashed out again today at Congress, criticizing it for “a constant string of investigations.”

docs.lead_paragraph: The insurer has agreed to improve its rankings of physicians in response to an investigation of insurers suspected of directing patients to cheaper doctors, according to the New York Attorney General.

headline.main: Amid State Inquiry, Cigna Agrees to Revise Doctor Ranking Program
headline.print_headline: Amid State Inquiry, Cigna Agrees to Revise Doctor Ranking Program

docs.snippet: The insurer has agreed to improve its rankings of physicians in response to an investigation of insurers suspected of directing patients to cheaper doctors, according to the New York Attorney General.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Swiss and Dutch health care systems are suddenly all the rage, and next month the United States’ top health official will visit Switzerland and the Netherlands to kick the tires.

headline.main: Looking at Dutch and Swiss Health Systems
headline.print_headline: Looking at Dutch and Swiss Health Systems

docs.snippet: The Swiss and Dutch health care systems are suddenly all the rage, and next month the United States’ top health official will visit Switzerland and the Netherlands to kick the tires.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic presidential candidates are actively courting the Service Employees International Union.

headline.main: A Union With Clout Stakes Its Claim on Politics
headline.print_headline: A Union With Clout Boldly Stakes Its Claim on Politics

docs.snippet: Democratic presidential candidates are actively courting the Service Employees International Union.

docs.lead_paragraph: Humana posted sharply higher quarterly profit, above Wall Street’s average estimate, on strength in Medicare health plans for the elderly and its plans for employers.
docs.snippet: Humana posted sharply higher quarterly profit, above Wall Street’s average estimate, on strength in Medicare health plans for the elderly and its plans for employers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Governor Meskill steered Connecticut away from the edge of bankruptcy, instituted a state lottery and oversaw the creation of a department of environmental protection in the 1970s.

headline.main: Thomas J. Meskill Dies at 79; Ex-Congressman, Connecticut Governor and Federal Judge
headline.print_headline: Thomas J. Meskill, 79, Ex-Congressman, Connecticut Governor and Federal Judge

docs.snippet: Governor Meskill steered Connecticut away from the edge of bankruptcy, instituted a state lottery and oversaw the creation of a department of environmental protection in the 1970s.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Barack Obama and former Senator John Edwards took on Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, saying she was not being direct on Social Security and suggesting she was too cozy with lobbyists.

headline.main: Rivals Go After Clinton Over Social Security and Donations
headline.print_headline: Rivals Go After Clinton Over Social Security and Donations

docs.snippet: Senator Barack Obama and former Senator John Edwards took on Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, saying she was not being direct on Social Security and suggesting she was too cozy with lobbyists.

docs.lead_paragraph: Philip B. Corbett, who oversees language issues for the newsroom, is answering questions Oct. 29-Nov. 2.

headline.seo: Philip B. Corbett -- Talk to the Newsroom -- The New York Times -- Reader Questions and Answers
headline.main:
Talk to the Newsroom:
Deputy News Editor Philip B. Corbett

docs.snippet: Philip B. Corbett, who oversees language issues for the newsroom, is answering questions Oct. 29-Nov. 2.

docs.lead_paragraph: With November arriving this week, Congressional Democrats are set to begin making their first serious moves in what has become an intricate legislative chess match with the White House over the stalled annual spending bills.
docs.abstract: Republicans want to shift focus away from the children's health insurance bill, which the Senate takes up later in the week.
docs.snippet: Republicans want to shift focus away from the children's health insurance bill, which the Senate takes up later in the week.
